page.title: 15CASTLE HILL & PREHISTORY
page.content:
Situated in parkland on the Ewell side of Chessington (Rollesby Rd.), Castle Hill is now little more than a mound of earth.
It is in fact a{prehistoric fort} (which may explain the finding of a {neolithic axe}2km west of here in 1962). The crest of the mound measures 40m. along its northern face (nearest the road), but is much wider in the south (70m.) There is a prominence in the SE corner.
By far the most interesting side is the western one; here the Bonesgate Stream & its steep valley are built into the design as a natural ditch & moat. Even today, the rampart on this side is sheer. It is 15m. high, whereas the 'walls' reach no more than 2 or 3m. on the other 3 sides.
